Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Johannes Gropengeter was ordained a priest in the Order of Saint Augustine. On 9 Jan 1499, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Alexander VI as Auxiliary Bishop of Minden, and Titular Bishop of Paneade. He served as Auxiliary Bishop of Minden until his resignation on 25 Jan 1508. == References == Category:15th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:16th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Alexander VI Category:Augustinian bishops
title: Johannes Gropengeter
